titles.title: Captive Primate Safety Act of 2005
Captive Primate Safety Act of 2005
Captive Primate Safety Act of 2005
A bill to amend the Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 to add non-human primates to the definition of prohibited wildlife species.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

calendar.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Reported by Senator Inhofe without amendment. With written report No. 109-263.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 471.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Fisheries and Oceans.

bill.summary: 7/11/2006--Passed Senate without amendment. Captive Primate Safety Act of 2005 - Amends the Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 to add non-human primates to the definition of "prohibited wildlife species" to which such Act's requirements (e.g., prohibition against sale or purchase in interstate or foreign commerce) apply.
